definitions.definition: a chemical element. Gold is a yellow precious metal used for making coins, jewellery, beautiful objects, etc.

examples.text: **gold coins/jewellery**
He always wore a gold chain.
a gold ring/watch/necklace/bracelet
a fall in the **gold price**
The rubies were set in 18-carat gold.
made of **solid/pure gold**
He spent weeks panning for gold in the river.
In the afternoon he struck a rich vein of gold.

definitions.definition: money, jewellery, etc. that is made of gold

examples.text: The hotel was dripping with *(= decorated with a lot of)* gold.
They're stockpiling dollars the way nations used to hoard gold.
the country’s gold reserves
falling government gold stocks

definitions.definition: a medal made of gold that is given to the winner of a race or competition

examples.text: The team look set to **win** Olympic **gold**.
He won three golds and a bronze.
She got a gold in the long jump.
She's going for gold this time.
a sunset of burnished gold
His hair was a pale gold.
I love the reds and golds of autumn.

definitions.definition: not everything that seems good, attractive, etc. is actually good, etc.
a large prize or reward that somebody hopes for but is unlikely to get
behaving in a way that other people approve of

examples.text: The kids have been as good as gold all day.

definitions.definition: to be a very kind person
used to say that it seems easy to make money in a place
to find or do something that brings you a lot of success or money

examples.text: He has struck gold with his latest novel.
A good mechanic is worth his weight in gold.

wordOrigin: Old English, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch goud and German Gold, from an Indo-European root shared by yellow.
